review_title: Fantastic place for your MS in Bio
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros:
I enrolled at NIU with the intention of improving my GPA and applying for a PhD program. Tuition is relatively cheap, but the kicker is that you can get tuition waivers, fellowships, and TAships relatively easily. I paid for 1 semester of school, and they paid for everything else. Can't beat that.

On the academic side, it's what you would expect from a mid-tier state school. You get what you put into it. I'm very glad I went there, it opened so many doors for me.
cons:
The stipend is abysmal, but for a MS student you have to consider the difference between getting paid poorly and having to pay tuition. The department is well-run, pick your committee carefully and you'll be fine.

Work-Life balance is what you make of it. I wanted to move forward with my research and career so I skewed things more towards work. Do some rotations and figure out which professors work well with your personality.

Avoid picking sides with cliques and you will have plenty of opportunities to socialize with other students. Overall, everyone was extraordinarily welcoming and always willing to help.

pros: Flexibility in Schedule and great benefits
cons: Poor leadership, short notice on contract submission, does not follow UPI agreements, poor follow through of department chair

review_title: Comfy place to work, but standard government worker attitudes abound
pros: There's no question NIU has outstanding benefits (health, vision, dental, tons of vaca and sick time, free tuition).  Work/life balance is the rule here and there are very few people at mid level and below who really have to break their necks working excessive hours.
cons: Typical government worker attitudes are EVERYWHERE.  It can be really hard to adjust if you've ever been in corporate.  There's too much "What's in it for me" attitudes among a lot of employees and very little doing a good job for doing a good job's sake.  There's a culture of inertia that no one seems to want to change, which can be frustrating.  However, if you get the right manager (and at least a nice crop of co-workers), this place can be heaven on earth.

review_title: Get paid to go to school
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Plenty of opportunity to network and prepare for careers, outstanding faculty, great place to learn
cons:
Misguided management:  staff ratio to professors is way out of control, even though professors are primary revenue sources for academia, through grants and fellowships
Crippled by a corrupt and meaningless state legislature
Poor location

job_title: Career Success Coordinator in DeKalb, IL
pros: Some of the nicest people and students I have ever worked with.  Staff  seem on the whole the most student-focused group I have ever worked with.  Faculty, well, the run the gambit from really great and kind to really nuts and selfish.  Some areas of campus have gorgeous offices, while others have cracks running down their walls
cons: Incredibly low salaries for the amount of work required; haven't had raises in about 10 years; going through downsizing of non-union members; incredible inconsistency in the quality of physical work space --- some office are outdated dumps, like mine.  Very inconsistent workloads among support staff.

review_title: Extra Help means no benefits, only 25 hours per week
pros: At $15.00 per hour the pay rate is well above minimum wage.
cons:
Because of the Affordable Care Act Extra Help employees are limited to 25 hours per week so NIU doesn't have to give them health insurance. Also, after 900 hours Extra Help employees are laid off for 30 days. They are usually rehired, but there's no way to advance or earn more than about $16K per year.
The lack of a state budget and ever decreasing funding is hurting all of the state schools. There's a pretty steady stream of employees leaving and a serious drop in students attending the schools. Right now this is not a great place to start a career.

pros: The benefits are great and affordable. My colleagues are the best I've ever worked with.
cons: Huge decisions made by the president affect the 'little people' in extremely negative ways. We are not considered in these decisions, and are not heard when we voice concerns. Most of my coworkers have been at NIU for over a decade and never received a raise. When the cost of living goes up and there are no raises, it's the equivalent of being demoted and our quality of life is effected. Also, I believe any social security you've collected over the years is wiped out when you start at NIU and you become ineligible for it.

job_title: Graduate Staff Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: The professors and staff seem to really care about providing high quality education and in making the school the best it can be. Co-workers were usually upbeat and easy to get along with.
cons: Administration at the departmental, college, and university level is overly bureaucratic and there are signs of nepotism everywhere. Professors and staff members get hired and promoted quickly when they have close ties (family/friendships) to legacy faculty and administration. Personal friends of certain officials gain high paying positions while department budgets are repeatedly slashed. Many departments rely heavily on cheap student labor in the form of graduate TAs to make up for an inability to replace professors.

review_title: A great step towards an academic career
pros: People were generally nice and helpful. The student body is diverse and it was enjoyable to have them in the classroom. Compensation and benefits were competitive, specially since the city of Dekalb is very financially accessible.
cons: It's a bit ambivalent to say, but even though Dekalb/Sycamore are fine towns and the university's compensation could take you a long way, it is also a difficult place to live if you are searching for a full academic environment. It is perhaps advisable to reside in the nearby towns even if the overhead is higher.

pros: NIU employees are generally cheerful, helpful, and accessible. They really care about what the student is experiencing and about each other.  People look out for each other and truly care about  the students, staff, and faculty.
cons: Because of the state budget, NIU has to make cutbacks. Those cutbacks will affect the employment experience.  Not only have there been no raises in years, but now people are being laid off in order to cut back expenses. Unless you are a tenured faculty, you're job isn't secure.

review_title: NIU used to be a good place to work...not now.
pros: Civil Service rule used to protect workers. Intellectually stimulating atmosphere. Most faculty and staff cares about students.
cons: Recent financial shortfalls have turned the university into a place where faculty is protected - ours works at the university 2 or 3 days a week, when they are willing to travel the 60 miles from Chicago. The low-paid staff are primarily women and older while the men have the higher-paying admin and tech jobs.

pros:
This position is a student position. It is a graduate assistantship, which means that the tuition will be waived off. Apart from this, it is one of the highest paying on-campus jobs. 

As a writing coach, I work with students from several different majors and help them with their assignments, capstone project papers, literature reviews, and dissertations. The director of the department and other writing coaches are very friendly. I would recommend working here to students.
cons: Apart from students not being very accepting of my suggestions, I cannot think of anything else. But, this is so rare, it has happened to me only once in the 6 months that I worked here.

pros:
-> Great and engaging environment with the Professors
-> Tested and Assisted students assignments along with preparing solutions for the assignment programs.
-> Conducted in class presentations and attended regular office hours. 
-> Maximum of 10 hours personal presence in offices.
-> 2 to 3 hours of additional work every week.
-> 80% college fee waiver.
cons:
-> As it was a part-time the cons are often less. It gave a good income for a student part-time.
-> Department decides teaching assistants instead of professors for a course.

pros: As a state of Illinois employee, the benefits are great. Also, the university has some amazing people working for them. There is an overabundance of knowledge and experience to be shared.
cons: State of Illinois budget issues have really put a ton of strain on operations. There have been no raises in over 5 years. There are also some people in executive roles that have no idea how to treat people below them. Favoritism is a very real practice, even if that means overlooking the best candidates for jobs.

review_title: Great staff and friendly faculty but not enough facilities to study nanotechnology.
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Very friendly staff and work area. I really like my time in the department. It is good place to do chemistry in some specific specialization, like organic synthesis and semiconductors .
cons: Not a lot of facilities for material characterization but the school have and agreement with Argonne National laboratory  to use facilities by submitting proposal. The department  should exploit this opportunities.

review_title: Great benefits, pay not so much.
pros:
Working at Northern Illinois University like many other state jobs, you have pretty good job security and in this economy that is a good thing.

The benefits offered (vacation, sick time, tuition reimbursement, state retirement program) are very good.
cons:
The pay isn't very good, compared the same job at another company.  I do okay, but I know a lot of people that don't make enough to live on.

Also, there isn't a lot of room for advancement in some areas.

review_title: I am an Assistant Professor at the Medical Laboratory Sciences program
pros: Small class, great continuing education support, small classes. NIU is located in Dekalb and it is a great campus . They offer and excellent Honors program and engage undergraduate students in great research activities.
cons: High demand of research for all Faculty, even if an specific department have very  few resources. NIU has the same publications expectations for Faculty of Graduate program compared to the ones that only teaches undergraduate programs and do not have the support of Masters and PhD students to conduct high quality research.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in DeKalb, IL
pros: It was a good opportunity for me to further develop my profile and skills teaching in a specialty area.    Have received support and encouragement from the chair.
cons: NIU is in a similar fiscal position as many other IL institutions of higher education, which is a challenge for them.  The current President is doing a good job restructuring the university, despite what seems to be an unfair campaign against him. Change agents brought in to make reform cause waves, and I think these folks (or people they support) are angry they negatively affected in the wake of change.

review_title: A good place to work if you want to stress free job in college.
job_title: Computer Lab Attendant in DeKalb, IL
pros: It's the only job on campus that gives out end of semester bonus'.  Allowed to work on homework when work is done.  Easy, non-stressful job while also taking class.
cons: We have monthly work meetings that are completely pointless and a waste of time.  Other than that I'd say its the best job I could have on campus

job_title: IT Technical Associate in DeKalb, IL
pros: This is a wonderful, comfortable place to work. The ITS department is located in a beautiful building and the university offers benefits that are almost impossible to beat. A 37.5 hour work week, five weeks of vacation, tuition waivers etc.
cons: The main issue is that it's such a great place to work that there is pretty limited growth potential. Management is typically 45+ since people usually come to the university and stay for the rest of their careers. It's really a choice between comfort and work-life balance and pay/opportunity.

pros: NIU offers a master's program where I was able to receive a tuition waiver with Graduate Assistantship/Graduate Teaching Assistantship.  The facilities are adequate.  The professors are all individually assets.  Some of the professors stopped being active in their field they when reached full professor.  I was disappointed about that.
cons: Some of the faculty don't seem to like or respect each other.  There seens to be a lot of competition for resources and this may contribute to the lack of cooperation.

review_title: University is great, some departments are not
pros: The new President (2013) is amazing!!!  I am happy to be present during these wonderful changes.
cons: There are people that are past their retirement point.  They are not into positive change and hinder staff development and overall productivity and reputation of the department to external partners.

pros:
Faculty cares about students
Free tuition for two years while TAing
Often work less than 20 hours contracted every week
cons:
Working with undergraduates can be a pain
Work mounts up during midterms and finals
Can be hard to balance work with responsibilities of classes and research
Pay is not as good as other state schools for TAs

review_title: Not a great place to work if you think employees should count
pros: Tuition reimbursement program for employees, health insurance benefits, attractive campus
cons: Expensive parking for employees, little or no career advancement, state financial condition makes pension plans tenuous, little to no staff encouragement.

review_title: Research Associate (Public Opinion Laboratory; now a group within Center for Governmental Studies)
pros: The benefits are awesome, the group is very cohesive, and joining the Center for Governmental Studies is a great advantage for the group.The academic environment offsets the pay level of positions.
cons: The pay is not as high as the public sector, most non-teaching associates are on one-year temporary contracts, and funding from Illinois is an issue for the entire institution. Hiring is done by committee and not as transparent as it should be for some positions.

job_title: Software Support Specialist in DeKalb, IL
pros: It was a great place to work. The employees of the IT department were always available to help each other through a technical analysis. There was enough freedoms that you can take time for doctors appointments and such. You aren't so micromanaged that you have to explain yourself all day but yet there is structure and hands on management. You are trusted to have the job done when you emerge from your cubicle.
cons: It was hard to break into other roles with different technology within the department.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: You expand your current skillset with learning how to effectively convey ideas to your students.  It fits within your schedule which allows you to do your research and classes while having the flexibility to perform your TA duties.
cons: It is highly dependent on the classes/students you get. Sometimes you get classes that are difficult for the students in which case many hours will be spent outside of class helping them with their projects/homework.

review_title: It was a great school to learn and be a T.A. at
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros:
Very flexible hours, Low work load depending on teacher and how much you want to do.
Covers most of tuition and you get paid.
cons: Some professors give little to no guidance, this means you don't learn as much as you should.   Students are often confused.  Being a R.A. might be better for jobs.

job_title: Events Administrator/Assistant Manager in DeKalb, IL
pros: It's a major employer in the DeKalb area.  Most employees depending on their classification get lots of sick days and vacation days.
cons: There are no raises. Ever. The state is not paying the University. Cuts and layoffs. They underpay and overwork. The environment is not a good one where I'm at.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Waived tuition for graduate students by being a TA. Overall TA load was not too bad or unreasonable. Fun people to work with and a good diversity of classes available.
cons: Not paid very much and did not receive any benefits.  But these things are expected since it is for a TA position and not intended to be a full time job.

job_title: Service Desk Analyst in DeKalb, IL
pros: If your looking to get into the ITS Dept this is a good place to get your foot in the door. Plus your education is FREE for being an employee. Great benefits and most holidays off that follow the school schedule.
cons: State funds to the school is hurting pay increases. Promotions come only if you take on a new postilion in a different dept. Once the State of IL gets their act together... then the pay increases will follow.

review_title: A lot of fun and running around.
pros: Good people at HSC run concessions.  Bill is a great person to work for.  Football games were fun, even if you wanted to pass out toward the end of some early season games.  Best hot dogs around.
cons: The environment is extremely political and some members of HSC management are out of touch.  Internal controls are poor.  Practically anyone can get access to the kitchens and alcohol storage with a little effort.

review_title: Take the bad with the good
job_title: Don't Care to Say in DeKalb, IL
pros: Benefits for non-union employees are great.  There is quite a bit of flexibility in the department I work, as long as I get my work done, which I do.
cons: The University is in a state of flux.  There are so many changes going on, maybe too many at once, and there is some suffering because of it.

review_title: Great benefits with low pay, and
pros: Great health, dental, vision and educational benefits at Northern Illinois University.  Another plus is the time off during the holidays.
cons: The pay is low compared to other jobs, and pay raises only come about every two or three years working as a non union employee.

review_title: As a teaching assistant, it is okey to work for Northern Illinois University.
pros:
pays for your tuition, and most instructors are nice.
I enjoy working with students. Very good time working as a TA.
Office staff are nice and helpful
cons: Job placement is not very good because of the economy right now. And Northern Illinois University is not a top school.

review_title: Large institutuion of higher education. Opportunities vary by department.
pros: A good place for professional growth. Staff can tap into campus hidden job market. Education and training benefits. Work with and learn from smart people on staff. Rich cultural life--lectures, concerts, performances free or reasonably priced.
cons: State if Illinois financial difficulties make wage freezes and low wage increases a way of doing business. Slow moving bureaucracy limits oir stalls innovation in some cases.

pros: Working at Northern, there are endless possibilities.  There are positions available in almost any field. Their goal is to keep every employee permanently, which makes job security issues much less concerning.
cons: Since this is a state university, benefits, such as insurance can be ever changing. Although this is no fault of the company, and all to the state, it is still something that concerns individuals who are looking to retire from this company.

pros: As a student worker I had a great experience working for NIU in the library. The hours were very flexible and they were always willing to work around my finals schedule
cons: The pay is not amazing but that is expected as a student worker. We did not get raises but also we weren't working there as a full career.

review_title: Working on campus at NIU has been very flexible and helpful for me as a full time student.
pros:
I can always rely on other students to cover or switch shifts with me. 
Management is very friendly and understanding of students needs.
They are considerate of work/life balance.
cons:
No benefits or pay raises after working there for a long period of time
Not all University jobs are work-study eligible

pros: One of the best reasons to work at NIU is the people. Great workers and very down-to-earth.  The job responsibilities allow lower level workers to do work normally given to higher level professionals especially in the areas of finance and budget.
cons: The big downside is that Northern is also one of the lowest paying state universities in Illinois.

pros: Excellent benefits, good vacation and sick time accrual. Varied departments and options for movement. You can get good experience and take it to the private sector and make more money.
cons: Poor pay for average workers. Administration and some directors get good pay while clerical staff, housing, dining, building services worker pay is stagnant and why staff unionized in many areas.

pros: I have a fairly stable job with this employer and it has great life/work balance. My supervisor give me some flexibility to do my job.
cons: I feel there is little or no chance for advancing my career here and that worries me sometimes. The pay is not that great due to the problems with Illinois.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: The working time is very flexible. I can always keep effective communication with my GA professor. The job is also rewarding.
cons: Sometimes it was hard to grade the hand-written assignments. I felt kind of ineffective. If more assignments were types, things would be better.

review_title: I love working at the university!!
pros: you'll meet a lot of students, future employers, fun and exciting environment. if you have decided not to work there anymore, always refer your friend, so they might be lucky enough to work there as well.
cons: temporary position and no guarantee of full time position. If you if can get graduate assistant ship, this position should be a breeze. no health insurance or other benefits

job_title: ITS Inventory Clerk/Office Support Associate in DeKalb, IL
pros:
Great people
Reasonable scheduling
Understanding management

They really went above and beyond in working with their employees, both student and full time alike.
cons:
Somewhat low pay

It's somewhat hard to compare since they are a state school, but my general feeling is that most of the departments for which I worked did not pay competitively.

review_title: It's been a good experience, not completely happy with the pay, but the benefits are helpful.
job_title: Office Support Specialist in DeKalb, IL
pros: There is a great since of community at Niu! Depending on your department, you can really learn a lot. Having the university pay for school is great!
cons: The only con I have is there haven't been raised in 4 years. I think we all work too hard to not be paid adequately.

pros: There were very nice people, they are willing to take time to train you.  There is a great summer schedule, usually off on Fridays. Also, there are a lot of student worker jobs in different fields.
cons: I didn't find there to be many downsides, I truly enjoyed working there.  It is great preparation to work in higher education.

pros:
-By doing your job, you become better at professional skills that will help you after you graduate (resume reviews, helping students with job hunts)
-Able to work in multiple divisions to ensure you have interests on the projects you are working on
cons:
-Ensure better performance with possible pay incentives
-Nothing else that I can think of

pros:
fresh air and peaceful environment.
Parties on Thursdays and Fridays.
buses on week days (number 2 3 5)
Feels like 1970's college environment
Library is awesome
cons:
Incapable HR department.
No control over who is hiring whom on what basis and when???
Retro Environment 
No buses or safe line cars when it snows. Be ready to walk and slip at-least once (blue cross blue shield will take care)

pros: only large employer in the area
cons: Many backstabbing coworkers, substandard working conditions-ie crowded offices, old buildings, very low below substandard wages. Something wrong with HR is always telling outsiders that they have no qualifications for the jobs and who gets jobs. Several generations of townies hire their family members and friends. Enrollment declining yearly.

job_title: Undegrad Web Developer in DeKalb, IL
pros: Working as a web developer for NIU allows for great flexibility of schedule and a great time off policy. There are so many opportunities to learn, and it provides freedom in applying the latest web technologies and plenty of open source plugins.
cons: I have no complaints in my time working here.

pros: I am new to this country,  working as a graduate assistant not only helped me academically but in getting along with people here.
cons: I see there are no cons working here because the position gave me a lot to learn about and implement.

review_title: Management was poor, but the people were amazing
pros: Majority of people are willing to help you until you get on your feet. If you're a student, their flexible schedules make it easy to work around classes.
cons: Absolute lack of standardization. Almost zero training process and they expect you to be 100% engaged without instructions.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: I got a GA in which I was interested. Working with the professor and a friend was great.
cons: The salary was a little less than expected. The assistantship was only for 10 hours, should've been more hours.

pros:
-Learned on the job
-Flexible hours
-Good knowledge for future opportunities
-unique projects
-room to be creative
cons:
-Very low pay
-not much support as it is a research institution
-projects a little ambitious for the budget

review_title: I felt pleased to work in Northern Illinois University
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: My experience at NIU has been enriching inside and outside of the classroom.
cons: I don't really have any foreign teachers which is good and the classes are a lot easier.

pros: The main perk of this position is the tuition waiver. The position also pays out a monthly stipend based on a set number of hours working.
cons: the duration of the salary lasts only during the semester time span whether or not the position will continue the following semester. Also the number of hours a student can work are limited.

pros: NIU was one of the friendliest environments I've ever worked. My colleagues became more than just coworkers--they were family.
cons: The current financial uncertainty in the state created unease among many faculty and staff. That's hardly a knock on the university, but it's something to be aware of before applying for any role at a state-funded entity.

pros: Splendid environment and staff.  Working with young adults in higher education is a great career and NIU adds to that joy.
cons: I have no cons that I can think of to share presently.  I work with international MBA candidates and they have a different mindset that seems to diminish any cons.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Professors are professional and concerned for your academics. If I have an exam, They are considerate enough to work out their schedule so it doesn't hurt my academic performance. Have learned alot !
cons: Sometimes the load gets really heavy. Exam and GA duty together become a headache when you have them together. The rest is smooth

review_title: Wonderful place to work; one of the last places with job security
pros: A place of learning where lifelong scholarship is encouraged.  Also, excellent benefits including lots of sick and vacation time and paid holiday leave when school is closed.
cons: Limited mobility--once people are in a job, they tend to stay a long time.

review_title: A great place to start your career
job_title: Directory Services Engineer II in DeKalb, IL
pros: A wide range of responsibilities due to short staffing allows you to learn many different roles at once.  They are very much in favor of furthering your education via NIU or other state colleges (tuition waver) and training.  Very flexible work schedule.
cons: The only downsides are the salary and staff reshuffling.

pros:
- Employee friendly atmosphere
- Can be associated with scholarly minds 
- Can have exposure to advanced research projects
- Good place to study
cons:
- Cannot have exposure to practical implementation of technology.
- Lack understanding of real-time industrial environment
- Limitation to exposure of real--time practices.

job_title: College of Engineering and Engineering Technology Tutor in DeKalb, IL
pros: Working as a tutor at NIU helps you re-learn what you would have forgotten as a student. It gives you a chance to inspire your juniors which instills a sense of giving back to the community.
cons: There are actually no downsides, they pay well and are accommodating of your schedule, so a thumbs up to NIU

review_title: Good, hands-on experience (Research credits and volunteer work)
pros: It varies with which professor you work with. For the most part, you are not without guidance from the professor or graduate researchers. You get to apply years of laboratory techniques to real-world situations.
cons: Trying to balance school, research and another full time or part time job can be very tricky.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Great opportunities for growth, I learned a lot. There are a lot of research opportunities to maximize your education.
cons: I wish we received more training. I felt very unprepared to teach a class. I've heard some departments get even less than the one week of training we were given.

pros: Great boss and a fun staff to work with. Very accommodating with school schedule.
cons: Depending on the weekend shifts it can take up your entire night with sometimes is not a bad thing because your working with great people.

review_title: Great job to have after undergrad
pros: Great job to have if you are apart of an assistantship. Teacher's are always there to help. Students are respectful majority of the time.
cons: You're working more than part time hours but you're still getting a great deal with having a tuition waiver and getting paid.

pros:
Good place and environment to work.
If you really work hard, and if you are talented. One will definitely get a GA
cons: one has to really work hard to get a Graduate Assistantship.

pros: The duties help you grow leaps and bounds and are exactly what a teaching Assistant needs.
cons: Things might get hectic at exam time but he university makes its best effort to avoid that from happening.

review_title: Non-communication bureaucratic headache, with nothing but requirement fulfillment.
pros: Free room and board, with a room to yourself.
cons: A complete lack of caring about the aims the university is shoving on us to shove on the students.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros:
Pay for TA's pretty standard.
Lots of support whenever needed.
Low pressure; allows you to focus on more important things, like research.
cons:
Wages barely enough to live on; you won't be taking any vacations.
Not enough departmental support from the university; salary suffers.

pros: Work culture is amazing. The pay is timely without any delays. Holidays are approved easily upon request.
cons: Pay scale is not the best. Growth in career is limited. Location of business is very far from major cities.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Good experience for a student. Great exposure to the programming languages. Students get a chance to improve their problem solving abilities.
cons: Not many cons. The office I worked for had pipe lines at the ceiling that carry acid to/from chemistry lab. That is scary.

pros: Vacation time and holiday time off a plus.  Large office, good colleagues for the most part.  Tuition reimbursement a big plus.
cons: Public University, meaning low chance of raise.  Budget cuts create uncertainty for keeping job. A lot of older buildings that need remodeling.

pros:
Fun to work on a campus 
Flexible work hours somewhat
Hour lunch 
Good training opportunities 
Supplies needed are plentiful 
Online website is informative
cons:
Wages LOW
Amount if work HIGH
Work ethic in office was pathetic 
Tech support is hit and miss
Paperwork is overwhelming

pros: Great way to gain experience. A lot of hands on work opportunities.
cons: Only allotted 20 hours a week to work.

review_title: NIU is good for international students who require some financial help
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: a good number of GAs, RAs, TAs are available
cons: doesnt have a strong course work for engineering although it is one of the costliest in the campus

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Friendly environment and freedom of using different technologies. Ease of work hours and great place to work and surrounding locations are nice
cons:
Not much of profile growth while I worked there.
Place is kind of remote to the city. Takes a long time to go to lively place.

pros: I love the atmosphere and the people I work with.  The medical premiums are low.
cons: The pay - it is insulting to be getting paid so low from a state university. I am making poverty level income.

job_title: ITS Lab Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros:
-Great supervisors
-No work pressure
- Can afford to study while working

ITS computer lad assistant is a great on campus job for students looking to work and also get to spend enough time to focus on academics.
cons: - Some of the rules don't make sense

review_title: Decent place for work in school
pros: Laid back culture, at least in my office. Most of the full-time employees want you to put school first and understand the weird schedules of college students.
cons: State-run, so a lot of bureaucracy and red tape are involved in everything.

pros: Pays well and allows you to get familiar with campus resources.  Job that all you to me new people
cons: Time consuming  and must be very flexible

pros: I am a people person, enjoyed help others gain knowledge and advancement
cons: The building was old with poor ventilation

pros: Free living and food, plus about $80 a month.
cons: Sometimes you're going to have to do things in the middle of the night, or super early morning, regardless of if you have a test the next day or not.

pros: Great Faculty for Accounting to prepare for CPA Exam. NIU CPA is one of the top ranked in US
cons: It is very far from a major city and commute /public transport is a big challenge

job_title: Building Service Worker in DeKalb, IL
pros:
-Good Pay
-Good benefits including all holidays off, paid time off, 401k..etc
-8 semester hours of tuition waved per semester for employees
cons: This is janitorial work so some of the work can be not so pleasant at times

pros: Personal Growth of how to teach and/or explain concepts to people, you fine your own knowledge of material and give yourself a stronger base within it
cons: Ignorant students expecting to learn all material right before tests and finals

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: It gives great opportunity to graduate students to work as graduate teaching assistants with eminent professors and gain insightful experience in the education field.
cons: The selection process should be more fair enough and more of merit based

pros: Health insurance and colleagues are generally decent people
cons: Like the state of Illinois, corrupt to the core. Best chance for advancement is if you are related to certain folks on campus.

review_title: Thick Skin Needed for Maximum Success
pros: Benefits, Coworkers, Perks, Working with Student-Athletes
cons: Communication, Low Morale on Campus, Lack of Community Support

pros: Easy schedules and supervisors who are incredibly helpful. I do not have many complaints about working for NIU while pursuing a degree.
cons: The pay is pretty low for some departments and positions when on an assistantship.

review_title: Nice to work as a student employee
pros:
- Lenient work culture 
- Timely pay
- Nice place to work
cons:
- need to submit time sheet
- might miss a pay if failed to submit a time sheet 
- Less pay

pros: Benefits are good, flexible with time off requests
cons: State jobs not too secure in Illinois, went 7 years straight no raises.

job_title: Assistant Vice President in DeKalb, IL
pros: People and leadership and simply wonderful. Everyone works as a team vs trying to one up one another.
cons: Raises are few and far between negotiate a great salary up front.

pros: Great work environment overall and a great work culture.
cons: Pay is lacking compared to comparable positions.

review_title: Great Benefits & Experience & Very Fair Compensation
pros: Free Tuition, Monthly Stipend, Great Experience, Lots of Responsibility & Flexibility in performance
cons: Limited # of hours, limited career advancement after graduation

pros: Open for diversity, minorities, and underrepresented groups. High level of education as well as of research.
cons: Limited funds for research available. A state university, which suffers budget problems withe the State of Illinois.

pros: This job is best a student can hope for during their studies and the Management and staff is very kind and helpful.
cons: There are no cons for this job, everything is perfect

review_title: State is going through budget crisis.
pros: Great environment, good people to work with. If the budget allows, GAs can travel for conferences.
cons: Budget crisis, difficulty in programming. Wasn't able to travel the second year of assistantship.

pros: Ability to get paid to do your classwork
cons: Extremely boring if you don't have anything to do. Work or otherwise during the shift.

review_title: Great people make it a great place to work
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

pros: Good hours, easy to work for if your a student and the people are all great
cons: Trying to get done right away that requires approval probably wont happen.

pros: Great benefits, dedicated people who are a pleasure to work with.
cons: Crappy pay, putting up with State of Illinois bull****

review_title: Very good college to work in
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: very friendly staff , helpful in every way
cons: less funds, need more cleaning in the laboratories

review_title: Student Worker within the NIU Foundation
pros: Flexible Hours, Priority on Education First, Caring Co-workers, Tight-knit Huskie Community
cons: Currently going through many changes because recovering from lack of budget for the last couple years

pros: The benefits package is very generous.
cons: I felt like it was not a supportive environment and there was no room for advancement in the area that I worked.

review_title: Easy work, but the office I work in is a mess (Admission).
job_title: Office Support Specialist in DeKalb, IL
pros:
Good work/life balance
Easy hours
Easy work
Excellent benefits
cons:
Low pay
Disarray in Admissions has led to enormous turnover in the last year

review_title: I worked as a student employee and it was a great experience overall
pros: flexible scheduling, very understanding with certain situations, friendly, outgoing atmosphere
cons: I don't have anything bad to say about this institution

pros: Work with an educated and engaged staff. Everyone wants to do their best work.
cons: There is little opportunity for advancement, and there has been a salary freeze since 2012.

job_title: Computer Science Graduate Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Very rewarding to help students with their programs
cons: Can be a terrible experience depending on the teacher you are assigned.

job_title: OFFICE ADMINISTRATOR/ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT in DeKalb, IL
pros: Benefits are good, especially time off.
cons: Wages below the poverty level

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros:
Working Under Professors give professional hand over take over experience.
Sharing the expertise and knowledge from Professors.
cons: Work gets redundant over the semesters

review_title: Great place who needs a stable job
pros: Great Poeple to work with. Good work/life balance.
cons:
Far from Chicago if you want to live in city
Salary is too low for what you do.

pros: Free housing, free meal plan
cons: Lack of privacy, on-call, claimed to be working 20 hours so you need to get permission to work an extra 5 on campus

review_title: Good place to work as a graduate student
job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: The department treats every student equally and give students work oppotunities as more as possible.
cons: Small town to live and not a lot of fun.

review_title: Great people to work with. Excellent working environment.
pros: Great University, Exposure to various kinds of people and process.
cons: Perks and taxes. Found nothing wrong at this place. I just love this University.

pros: Great team and leaders to show support, guidance. Great training, benefits, and opportunity to grow within the division.
cons: Can't really say anything bad, some time rough hours

pros: Lots of more realistic experience available in my major. Freedom to give ideas and opinions on improvement.
cons: They tend to prefer work-study students for jobs. Minimum wage.

pros: The people I worked with were all great.
cons: If I were to be hired as a route driver I would have to learn to drive a semi.

pros: They are still managing to pay us during the state budget crisis.
cons: As will most state universities in Illinois a lot of our budget lines are severely restricted.

pros: Great group of people, enjoyable to work with. Relax atmosphere but results oriented.
cons: Not all needed resources were available.

job_title: Student Association Director in DeKalb, IL
pros:
You get your own office
Flexible hours
Great support
Driven coworkers
cons:
long onboarding process
University does not always listen to student needs

pros: Experience working with chair of the department and Working on HTML and Java added to my software skills
cons: To understand the concepts of Computer languages

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: weather, It is so cold and windy all the time.
cons: People, Cultural activities, Qualified professionals around you all the time, you get to learn a lot

pros: excellent work freedom. Great for research progress in varied fields.
cons: work alone most of the times.

review_title: Best place to work. Super nice people
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: Great pay. Friendly staff. Super nice people
cons: No interview to get the job.

pros: People are very friendly. Lots of opportunity to delve into your work and gain great experience. Flex schedules during summer months.
cons: Salary on the low side.

review_title: I prefer this University. Good academic course and well teaching faculty
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in DeKalb, IL
pros: I prefer this University. Good academic course and well teaching faculty
cons: I saw no disadvantages during my program.

review_title: NIU Naperville Campus is a great place to work
pros: Lots of room space several degrees offered MBA programs
